sentences.en: A vicious price war between manufacturers has cut margins to the bone.
sentences.cn: 制造商之间的恶性价格战已将利润削减到了最低。

sentences.en: Costs have been cut by 30 to 50 per cent.
sentences.cn: 成本降低了30%到50%。

sentences.en: Cut down and compost spent cucumbers, tomatoes and other crops.
sentences.cn: 将已收获过的黄瓜、西红柿和其他作物的秧蔓割下，制成堆肥。

sentences.en: David has cut a dashing figure on the international social scene.
sentences.cn: 在国际社交场合戴维已经崭露头角。

sentences.en: Do you want me to cut the cake?
sentences.cn: 要我切蛋糕吗？

sentences.en: Hopes of an early cut in interest rates bolstered confidence.
sentences.cn: 利率有望早日下调，从而增强了人们的信心。

sentences.en: I cut it out and pinned it to my studio wall.
sentences.cn: 我把它剪下来钉在我工作室的墙上。

sentences.en: I'm just not cut out to be a policeman.
sentences.cn: 我真不是当警察的料。

sentences.en: Immediately, Daniel cut in on Joanne's attempts at reassurance.
sentences.cn: 乔安妮刚要作保证，丹尼尔就把她打断了。

sentences.en: Scientists are warning that unless carbon emissions are cut, we could be heading for an environmental catastrophe.
sentences.cn: 科学家警告说如果不减少碳排放量，我们可能会面临环境灾难。

sentences.en: Serve the cake warm or at room temperature, cut in squares.
sentences.cn: 等蛋糕温热或凉至室温时切成四方块端上桌。

sentences.en: Seven hundred jobs will be lost in order to cut costs and boost profits.
sentences.cn: 为了降低成本，提高利润，将削减700个职位。

sentences.en: She had quite severe bruising and a cut lip.
sentences.cn: 她身上有严重的淤伤，嘴唇也破了。

sentences.en: she's a cut above the rest.
sentences.cn: 她比旁人高出一等。

sentences.en: Staffing levels had already been cut to the bone (= reduced to the lowest level possible ) .
sentences.cn: 人员配备已经削减到了最低限度。

sentences.en: That’s quite a nasty cut – you ought to get it seen to by a doctor.
sentences.cn: 这个伤口很严重，你应该让医生处理一下。

sentences.en: The building plans could be hit by possible spending cuts .
sentences.cn: 这些建筑规划也许会因为支出可能缩减而受到影响。

sentences.en: the championship is not as cut and dried as everyone thinks.
sentences.cn: 冠军归属不像人们所想的已成定局。

sentences.en: The curtains were half drawn to cut out the sunlight.
sentences.cn: 窗帘拉上了一半以遮挡阳光。

sentences.en: the cut and thrust of political debate.
sentences.cn: 政治辩论的针锋相对。

sentences.en: The cut of a diamond depends on the skill of its craftsman.
sentences.cn: 钻石切割靠的是工匠的技艺。

sentences.en: The economy needs an immediate 2 per cent cut in interest rates.
sentences.cn: 当前经济状况需要立即将利率下调两个百分点.

sentences.en: The exiles had been cut off from all contact with their homeland.
sentences.cn: 流亡者被切断了与家乡的所有联系。

sentences.en: The major aviation companies need to cut prices if they are to compete with budget airlines.
sentences.cn: 大航空公司如果想和廉价的航空公司竞争，就需要降低价格。

sentences.en: The once-powerful post unions have been cut down to size.
sentences.cn: 一度很强势的邮政联盟已经威风不再。

sentences.en: The telephone wires had been cut minutes before the assault.
sentences.cn: 袭击前几分钟，电话线已经被切断。

sentences.en: There will be cuts across all levels of the company.
sentences.cn: 公司上下各级都将削减开支。

sentences.en: They’re introducing CCTV cameras in an attempt to cut street crime in the area.
sentences.cn: 为了减少该地区的街头犯罪，他们安装了闭路电视摄像机。

sentences.en: We are constantly being reminded to cut down our fat intake.
sentences.cn: 不断有人提醒我们要减少脂肪的摄入量。

sentences.en: When she had attempted to cut his nails he resisted.
sentences.cn: 她试图给他剪指甲，他不让。

sentences.en: You need to cut the amount of fat and sugar in your diet.
sentences.cn: 你需要减少饮食中脂肪和糖的摄入量。

words.tran_cn: 刀具，切割机；切割者；裁剪者
削减；伤口；切口；（服装等的）式样；削球
[机]切割；相交；切牌；停拍；不出席

phrases.phrase: be cut out for (或 to be)

phrases.tran_cn: （衣着或行为上）出风头；引人注目
(非正式，主北美)（尤指商业上）达成协议，做生意
抄近路通过；径直穿过；打断
削减；修剪；（美）倒叙；[球]急忙返回
v. 削减；砍倒；杀死；删节；胜过
n. 切花，鲜切花；插瓶花
切断；中断；使死亡；剥夺继承权
无视某人存在，不屑一顾
(非正式)戳破（某人）自吹自擂，让（某人）识趣
精简；削减（某物，如某组织）的势力

trans.tran_cn: 伤口，破口，削减，发型，样式，份额，删减，割下的一块肉
trans.tran_en: a reduction in the size or amount of something, especially the amount of money that is spent by a government or company
to divide something or separate something from its main part, using scissors, a knife etc

trans.tran_cn: 切割，割破，切下，切成，修剪，削减，让…逃跑，释放，剪辑，停止，断绝关系，旷课，伤害，切牌，相交，灌制唱片，开始长(新牙）
trans.tran_en: to reduce the amount of something
